prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desiree DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. [info] 

To the Security at Lordly Tailor.

I will be coming to purloin the most
priceless work of art on display in
your "Treasures of Kurain" exhibit.

Take good care of the speckled urn, won't you...?

Yours truly,
Mask DeMasque
Pearl:
Um, these cute little pink splotches... They said that it's paint... And that they were put on the urn recently!
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. [info] 

Blackmail Letter

If you don't want your true
identity revealed to the world,
come to KB security at 1:00 AM
on October 12th and bring
$50,000.

If you don't, I'll take that red diamond you received the other day instead. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card → CEO Office Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: The urn was placed in a box, and Zvarri! It was then sent to the warehouse.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime...
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 5
Testimony: At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one.

First, the evidence list has 23 items, but the relevant ones seem to be:

- **Evidence 4**: The Sacred Urn was found in Luke Atmey's office, covered in pink splotches, and it's the genuine article. It was broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box and kept out of sight.

- **Evidence 22**: Paint Marks are completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago, knocking over some paint.

Now, looking at the testimonies, specifically Testimony 5 by Atmey:

- **Testimony 5**: Atmey claims he held the urn in his hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.

But wait, according to Evidence 4 and 22, the urn was already in Atmey's office before the crime, specifically broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks prior. The paint marks were dry, indicating that the urn had been moved earlier.

So, if the urn was already in Atmey's office before the crime, it contradicts his testimony that he held it for the first time during the crime. This suggests that Atmey's claim is false because the urn was already there prior to the crime.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through the information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main suspect is Ron DeLite, who claims to be the thief Mask DeMasque. There's also Luke Atmey, who seems to be framing Ron by planting evidence. The victim is Kane Bullard, the CEO of KB Security, whose body was found in his safe.

Looking at the evidence, I see that there's a blackmail letter found in Ron's room, written by Bullard. The letter threatens Ron with exposure unless he pays money. This suggests that Bullard was trying to blackmail Ron, possibly over his secret identity as Mask DeMasque.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Atmey claims that Bullard wrote the blackmail letter and that Ron killed Bullard because of it. However, the evidence shows that the letter was indeed written by Bullard, which supports Atmey's testimony. But wait, there's another piece of evidence: the CEO Office Buzzer Record, which shows the buzzer was activated at 1:02 AM on October 12th. This time coincides with the crime, suggesting that someone entered the office around that time.

If Atmey is testifying that Ron killed Bullard because of the blackmail, but the evidence shows that the buzzer was used at the time of the crime, which could indicate that someone else was involved. However, the key card found in Ron's wallet was used to access the CEO's office at 1 AM, which is close to the buzzer activation time. This suggests that Ron was indeed present and might have killed Bullard.

Wait, but the testimony says that Bullard wrote the letter, and the evidence confirms that. So maybe the contradiction isn't there. Perhaps I'm missing something. Let me check again.

Oh, I see. The testimony says that Bullard wrote the letter and that Ron killed him because of it. The evidence shows the letter was written by Bullard, which supports the testimony. However, the key card and buzzer record suggest that Ron was present, which aligns with the testimony. So maybe there's no contradiction here.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is elsewhere. Let me think again. Maybe the timing of the crime. The autopsy report says Bullard died at 1 AM, but the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. That's a two-minute difference. If Ron used the key card at 1 AM, he could have killed Bullard, and the buzzer went off two minutes later when he exited. So that doesn't contradict.

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating it. The main point is that the evidence supports the testimony, so there's no contradiction. But the user is asking for a pair that contradicts, so perhaps I'm missing something.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is that Atmey is testifying based on his deductions, but the evidence shows that the key card was used by Ron, which directly implicates him, contradicting Atmey's framing attempt. But no, Atmey is actually supporting Ron's guilt.

I think I might be stuck here. Maybe the contradiction is that Atmey's testimony about the blackmail letter is supported by the evidence, but the key card and buzzer suggest Ron's presence, which aligns with the testimony. So perhaps there's no contradiction, but the user expects one.

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is that Atmey's testimony about the blackmail letter being from Bullard is contradicted by the evidence that the letter was found in Ron's room, implying Ron received it, not sent it. Wait, no, the evidence says the letter was written by Bullard and found in Ron's room, so it's consistent.

I'm getting confused. Maybe I should look for the specific pair that contradicts. The user's previous examples show that they're looking for when evidence and testimony don't align. In this case, perhaps the testimony that Bullard wrote the letter is contradicted by the evidence that the letter was found in Ron's room, implying Ron received it, not wrote it. But that's not a contradiction because the evidence states the letter was written by Bullard.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is that Atmey testifies that Bullard wrote the letter, but the evidence shows the letter was found in Ron's room, which doesn't directly contradict but just places it there. So maybe there's no contradiction, but the user expects one.

Alternatively, perhaps the contradiction is that the testimony says Bullard wrote the letter, but the evidence shows it was found in Ron's room, implying Ron received it, which doesn't necessarily contradict but just shows possession.

I'm not sure. Maybe the contradiction is that Atmey's testimony about the blackmail letter is supported by the evidence, so there's no contradiction. But the user is asking for a pair, so perhaps I need to pick the closest one.

After reconsidering, I think the contradiction is that Atmey's testimony about the blackmail letter being from Bullard is supported by the evidence, so there's no contradiction. Therefore, the answer might be that there's no contradiction, but since the user expects a pair, I'll have to choose the closest one.

But to follow the instructions, I'll go with {"evidence": 10, "testimony": 5} as the answer, even though I'm not entirely confident.
</think>
